00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Absolute Value class
00004 #    (it works like a list, since it has "parens" at both ends)
00005 #
00006 package Parser::List::AbsoluteValue;
00007 use strict;
00008 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List);
00009 
00010 #
00011 #  Check that only one number is inside the |...|
00012 #
00013 sub _check {
00014   my $self = shift;
00015   $self->{type}{list} = 0;
00016   $self->Error("Only one value allowed within absolute values")
00017     if ($self->{type}{length} != 1);
00018   my $arg = $self->{coords}[0];
00019   $self->Error("Absolute value can't be taken of %s",$arg->type)
00020     unless $arg->type =~ /Number|Point|Vector/ || $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00021   $self->{type} = $Value::Type{number};
00022 }
00023 
00024 sub class {'AbsoluteValue'}; # don't report List
00025 
00026 #
00027 #  Compute using abs()
00028 #
00029 sub _eval {abs($_[1][0])}
00030 
00031 #
00032 #  Use abs() in perl mode
00033 #
00034 sub perl {
00035   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift;
00036   my $perl = 'abs('.$self->{coords}[0]->perl.')';
00037   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00038   return $perl;
00039 }
